title.narrative: Core Pipeline support and IPC/WASH interventions for flooded affected communities in South Sudan

description.narrative: The objective of this allocation is to reduce preventable morbidity and mortality as a result of the severe flooding while enhancing health facilities WASH Capacities in Rubkona, Leer, Mayom, Fashoda, Malakal, Tonj East, Canal/Pigi, Fangak, Ayod, Twic East, Guit, Mayendit, Panyijiar, Panyikang, Koch counties in South Sudan. Through this allocation, WHO ensure consistent access to quality medicines through the core-pipeline funding by distributing and replenishing medical supplies to health facilities using the 64 health cluster partners responding to the flood emergencies in the affected locations. The medical supplies improve access to basic health services and reduce health consequences of these emergencies among the 261,616 directly targeted affected people. WASH engagements (mainstreamed within the Health Cluster response) include water sample collection and testing for quality control and surveillance to ensure safe drinking water to reduce the water borne diseases such as watery diarrhea cases and other water related infections.
